info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 23 at 12:42PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT ROOSEVELT...EASTERN DE BACA... NORTHEASTERN CHAVES...SOUTHERN QUAY AND CURRY COUNTIES THROUGH 115 PM MST... At 1242 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles northwest of Taiban to 8 miles south of Elkins. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Clovis, Portales, Fort Sumner, Melrose, Elida, Dora, Grady, Causey, House, and Ranchvale. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Motorists can expect brief but sudden changes in visibility and ponding of water on highways as storms move through the area.
